text: The word of the Lord which came to Hosea the son of Beeri, during the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah, and during the days of Jeroboam the son of Joash, king of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Lord first spoke through Hosea, the Lord said to Hosea, “Go, take for yourself a wife inclined to infidelity, and children of infidelity; for the land commits flagrant infidelity, abandoning the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So he went and took Gomer the daughter of Diblaim, and she conceived and bore him a son.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said to him, “Name him Jezreel; for in just a little while I will punish the house of Jehu for the bloodshed of Jezreel, and I will put an end to the kingdom of the house of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: On that day I will break the bow of Israel in the Valley of Jezreel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then she conceived again and gave birth to a daughter. And the Lord said to him, “Name her Lo-ruhamah, for I will no longer take pity on the house of Israel, that I would ever forgive them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I will take pity on the house of Judah and save them by the Lord their God, and will not save them by bow, sword, battle, horses, or horsemen.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When she had weaned Lo-ruhamah, she conceived and gave birth to a son.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said, “Name him Lo-ammi, because you are not My people, and I am not your God.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet the number of the sons of Israel
Will be like the sand of the sea,
Which cannot be measured or counted;
And in the place
Where it is said to them,
“You are not My people,”
It will be said to them,
“You are the sons of the living God.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
And the sons of Judah and the sons of Israel will be gathered together,
And they will appoint for themselves one leader,
And they will go up from the land,
For the day of Jezreel will be great.
speaker: Narrator

text: Say to your brothers, “Ammi,” and to your sisters, “Ruhamah.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Dispute with your mother, dispute,
Because she is not my wife, and I am not her husband;
But she must remove her infidelity from her face
And her adultery from between her breasts,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Otherwise, I will strip her naked
And expose her as on the day she was born.
I will also make her like a wilderness,
Make her like desert land,
And put her to death with thirst.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Also, I will take no pity on her children,
Because they are children of infidelity.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For their mother has committed prostitution;
She who conceived them has acted shamefully.
For she said, ‘I will go after my lovers,
Who give me my bread and my water,
My wool and my flax, my oil and my drink.’
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore, behold, I will obstruct her way with thorns,
And I will build a stone wall against her so that she cannot find her paths.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And she will pursue her lovers, but she will not reach them;
And she will seek them, but will not find them.
Then she will say, ‘I will go back to my first husband,
Because it was better for me then than now!’
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Yet she does not know that it was I myself who gave her the grain, the new wine, and the oil,
And lavished on her silver and gold,
Which they used for Baal.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore, I will take back My grain at harvest time
And My new wine in its season.
I will also take away My wool and My flax
That I gave to cover her nakedness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So now I will uncover her lewdness
Before the eyes of her lovers,
And no one will rescue her from My hand.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will also put an end to all her joy,
Her feasts, her new moons, her Sabbaths,
And all her festivals.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And I will destroy her vines and fig trees,
Of which she said, ‘They are my wages for prostitution
Which my lovers have given me.’
And I will turn them into a forest,
And the animals of the field will devour them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will punish her for the days of the Baals
When she used to offer sacrifices to them
And adorn herself with her nose ring and jewelry,
And follow her lovers, so that she forgot Me,” declares the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Therefore, behold, I am going to persuade her,
Bring her into the wilderness,
And speak kindly to her.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then I will give her her vineyards from there,
And the Valley of Achor as a door of hope.
And she will respond there as in the days of her youth,
As in the day when she went up from the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And it will come about on that day,” declares the Lord,
“That you will call Me my husband
And no longer call Me my Baal.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I will remove the names of the Baals from her mouth,
So that they will no longer be mentioned by their names.
speaker: Narrator

text:
On that day I will also make a covenant for them
With the animals of the field,
The birds of the sky,
And the crawling things of the ground.
And I will eliminate the bow, the sword, and war from the land,
And will let them lie down in safety.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
And I will betroth you to Me in faithfulness.
Then you will know the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“And it will come about on that day that I will respond,” declares the Lord.
“I will respond to the heavens, and they will respond to the earth,
speaker: Narrator

text:
And the earth will respond to the grain, to the new wine, and to the oil,
And they will respond to Jezreel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will sow her for Myself in the land.
I will also have compassion on her who had not obtained compassion,
And I will say to those who were not My people,
‘You are My people!’
And they will say, ‘You are my God!’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said to me, “Go again, love a woman who is loved by her husband, yet is committing adultery, as the Lord loves the sons of Israel, though they turn to other gods and love raisin cakes.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So I purchased her for myself for fifteen shekels of silver, and a homer and a lethech of barley.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I said to her, “You shall live with me for many days. You shall not play the prostitute, nor shall you have another man; so I will also be toward you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: For the sons of Israel will live for many days without a king or leader, without sacrifice or memorial stone, and without ephod or household idols.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterward the sons of Israel will return and seek the Lord their God and David their king; and they will come trembling to the Lord and to His goodness in the last days.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Listen to the word of the Lord, you sons of Israel,
Because the Lord has a case against the inhabitants of the land,
For there is no faithfulness, nor loyalty,
Nor knowledge of God in the land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There is oath-taking, denial, murder, stealing, and adultery.
They employ violence, so that bloodshed follows bloodshed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore the land mourns,
And everyone who lives in it languishes
Along with the animals of the field and the birds of the sky,
And even the fish of the sea disappear.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet let no one find fault, and let no one rebuke;
For your people are like those who contend with a priest.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
My people are destroyed for lack of knowledge.
Since you have rejected knowledge,
I also will reject you from being My priest.
Since you have forgotten the Law of your God,
I also will forget your children.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The more they multiplied, the more they sinned against Me;
I will change their glory into shame.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They feed on the sin of My people,
And long for their wrongdoing.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text: Infidelity, wine, and new wine take away the understanding.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
They offer sacrifices on the tops of the mountains
And burn incense on the hills,
Under oak, poplar, and terebinth,
Because their shade is pleasant.
Therefore your daughters play the prostitute,
And your brides commit adultery.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will not punish your daughters when they play the prostitute,
Or your brides when they commit adultery,
Because the men themselves slip away with the prostitutes
And offer sacrifices with temple prostitutes;
So the people without understanding are ruined.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Though you, Israel, play the prostitute,
Judah must not become guilty;
Also you are not to go to Gilgal,
Nor go up to Beth-aven
And take the oath:
“As the Lord lives!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Since Israel is stubborn
Like a stubborn cow,
Will the Lord now pasture them
Like a lamb in a large field?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Ephraim is allied with idols;
Leave him alone.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
The wind wraps them in its wings,
And they will be put to shame because of their sacrifices.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear this, you priests!
Pay attention, house of Israel!
Listen, you of the house of the king!
For the judgment applies to you,
Because you have been a trap at Mizpah,
And a net spread out on Tabor.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And the rebels have gone deep in depravity,
But I will discipline all of them.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Their deeds will not allow them
To return to their God.
For a spirit of infidelity is within them,
And they do not know the Lord.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
They have dealt treacherously with the Lord,
For they have given birth to illegitimate children.
Now the new moon will devour them with their land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blow the horn in Gibeah,
And the trumpet in Ramah.
Sound an alarm at Beth-aven:
“Behind you, Benjamin!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Ephraim will become a desolation in the day of rebuke;
Among the tribes of Israel I make known what is trustworthy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The leaders of Judah have become like those who displace a boundary marker;
On them I will pour out My anger like water.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Ephraim is oppressed, broken by judgment,
Because he was determined to follow man’s command.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore I am like a moth to Ephraim,
And like rottenness to the house of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When Ephraim saw his sickness,
And Judah his sore,
Ephraim then went to Assyria
And sent word to King Jareb.
But he is unable to heal you,
Or to cure you of your sore.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I will be like a lion to Ephraim
And like a young lion to the house of Judah.
I, yes I, will tear to pieces and go away,
I will carry away, and there will be no one to rescue.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
So let’s learn, let’s press on to know the Lord.
His appearance is as sure as the dawn;
And He will come to us like the rain,
As the spring rain waters the earth.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
What shall I do with you, Ephraim?
What shall I do with you, Judah?
For your loyalty is like a morning cloud,
And like the dew which goes away early.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
For I desire loyalty rather than sacrifice,
And the knowledge of God rather than burnt offerings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But like Adam they have violated the covenant;
There they have dealt treacherously with Me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Gilead is a city of wrongdoers,
Tracked with bloody footprints.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
In the house of Israel I have seen a horrible thing;
Ephraim’s infidelity is there, Israel has defiled itself.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Also, Judah, there is a harvest appointed for you,
When I restore the fortunes of My people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When I would heal Israel,
The wrongdoing of Ephraim is uncovered,
And the evil deeds of Samaria,
For they practice deception;
The thief enters,
A band of robbers attack outside,
speaker: Narrator

text:
And they do not consider in their hearts
That I remember all their wickedness.
Now their deeds surround them;
They are before My face.
speaker: Narrator

text:
With their wickedness they make the king happy,
And the officials with their lies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They are all adulterers,
Like an oven heated by the baker,
Who stops stoking the fire
From the time the dough is kneaded until it is leavened.
speaker: Narrator

text:
On the day of our king, the officials became sick with the heat of wine;
He stretched out his hand with scoffers,
speaker: Narrator

text:
For their hearts are like an oven
As they approach their plotting;
Their anger smolders all night,
In the morning it burns like flaming fire.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All of them are hot like an oven,
And they consume their rulers;
All their kings have fallen.
None of them calls on Me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Ephraim is himself thrown about with the nations;
Ephraim has become a round loaf not turned over.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Strangers devour his strength,
Yet he does not know it;
Gray hairs also are sprinkled on him,
Yet he does not know it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Though the pride of Israel testifies against him,
Yet they have not returned to the Lord their God,
Nor have they sought Him, despite all this.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So Ephraim has become like a gullible dove, without sense;
They call to Egypt, they go to Assyria.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Woe to them, for they have strayed from Me!
Destruction is theirs, for they have rebelled against Me!
I would redeem them, but they have spoken lies against Me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And they do not cry to Me from their heart
When they wail on their beds;
For the sake of grain and new wine they assemble themselves,
They turn against Me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Although I trained and strengthened their arms,
Yet they devise evil against Me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They turn, but not upward,
They are like a loose bow;
Their officials will fall by the sword
Because of the insolence of their tongue.
This will be their derision in the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Put the trumpet to your lips!
Like an eagle the enemy comes against the house of the Lord,
Because they have violated My covenant
And rebelled against My Law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They cry out to Me,
“My God, we of Israel know You!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Israel has rejected the good;
The enemy will pursue him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have set up kings, but not by Me;
They have appointed officials, but I did not know it.
With their silver and gold they have made idols for themselves,
So that they will be eliminated.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has rejected your calf, Samaria, saying,
“My anger burns against them!”
How long will they be incapable of innocence?
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
For they sow wind
And they harvest a storm.
The standing grain has no kernels;
It yields no grain.
If it were to yield, strangers would swallow it.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Even though they pay for allies among the nations,
I will gather them up now;
And they will begin to diminish
Because of the burden of the king of officials.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Since Ephraim has multiplied altars for sin,
They have become altars of sinning for him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Though I wrote for him ten thousand precepts of My Law,
They are regarded as a strange thing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As for My sacrificial gifts,
They sacrifice the flesh and eat it,
But the Lord has taken no delight in them.
Now He will remember their guilt,
And punish them for their sins;
They will return to Egypt.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Do not rejoice, Israel, with jubilation like the nations!
For you have been unfaithful, abandoning your God.
You have loved the earnings of unfaithfulness on every threshing floor.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Threshing floor and wine press will not feed them,
And the new wine will fail them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They will not remain in the Lord’s land,
But Ephraim will return to Egypt,
And in Assyria they will eat unclean food.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
What will you do on the day of the appointed festival
And on the day of the feast of the Lord?
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
The days of punishment have come,
The days of retribution have come;
Let Israel know this!
The prophet is a fool,
The inspired person is insane,
Because of the grossness of your wrongdoing,
And because your hostility is so great.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
They are deeply depraved
As in the days of Gibeah;
He will remember their guilt,
He will punish their sins.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I found Israel like grapes in the wilderness;
I saw your forefathers as the earliest fruit on the fig tree in its first season.
But they came to Baal-peor and devoted themselves to shame,
And they became as detestable as that which they loved.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As for Ephraim, their glory will fly away like a bird—
No birth, no pregnancy, and no conception!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Though they bring up their children,
Yet I will bereave them of their children until not a person is left.
Yes, woe to them indeed when I depart from them!
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Give to them, Lord—what will You give?
Give them a miscarrying womb and dried-up breasts.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Ephraim is stricken, their root is dried up,
They will produce no fruit.
Even though they give birth to children,
I will put to death the precious ones of their womb.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Their heart is deceitful;
Now they must suffer for their guilt.
The Lord will break down their altars
And destroy their memorial stones.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Certainly now they will say, “We have no king,
For we do not revere the Lord.
As for the king, what can he do for us?”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
The inhabitants of Samaria will fear
For the calf of Beth-aven.
Indeed, its people will mourn for it,
And its idolatrous priests will cry out over it,
Over its glory, since it has left it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The thing itself will be brought to Assyria
As a gift of tribute to King Jareb;
Ephraim will be seized with shame,
And Israel will be ashamed of its own plan.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Samaria will be destroyed with her king,
Like a twig on the surface of the water.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Ephraim is a trained heifer that loves to thresh,
And I passed over her lovely neck;
I will harness Ephraim,
Judah will plow, Jacob will harrow for himself.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sow for yourselves, with a view to righteousness;
Harvest in accordance with kindness.
Break up your uncultivated ground,
For it is time to seek the Lord
Until He comes and rains righteousness on you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have plowed wickedness, you have harvested injustice,
You have eaten the fruit of lies.
Because you have trusted in your way, in your many warriors,
speaker: Narrator

text:
An uproar will arise among your people,
And all your fortresses will be destroyed,
As Shalman destroyed Beth-arbel on the day of battle,
When mothers were slaughtered with their children.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So it will be done to you at Bethel because of your great wickedness.
At dawn the king of Israel will be completely destroyed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When Israel was a youth I loved him,
And out of Egypt I called My son.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The more they called them,
The more they went away from them;
They kept sacrificing to the Baals
And burning incense to idols.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
And the sword will whirl against their cities,
And will destroy their oracle priests
And consume them, because of their counsels.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So My people are determined to turn from Me.
Though they call them to the One on high,
None at all exalts Him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How can I give you up, Ephraim?
How can I surrender you, Israel?
How can I make you like Admah?
How can I treat you like Zeboiim?
My heart is turned over within Me,
All My compassions are kindled.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will not carry out My fierce anger;
I will not destroy Ephraim again.
For I am God and not a man, the Holy One in your midst,
And I will not come in wrath.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They will walk after the Lord,
He will roar like a lion;
Indeed He will roar,
And His sons will come trembling from the west.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Ephraim surrounds Me with lies
And the house of Israel with deceit;
Judah is still unruly against God,
Even against the Holy One who is faithful.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Ephraim feeds on wind,
And pursues the east wind continually;
He multiplies lies and violence.
Moreover, he makes a covenant with Assyria,
And oil is brought to Egypt.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
In the womb he took his brother by the heel,
And in his mature strength he contended with God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yes, he wrestled with the angel and prevailed;
He wept and implored His favor.
He found Him at Bethel,
And there He spoke with us,
speaker: Narrator

text:
And the Lord, the God of armies,
The Lord is His name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So as for you, return to your God,
Maintain kindness and justice,
And wait for your God continually.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A merchant, in whose hands are fraudulent balances,
Loves to exploit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And Ephraim said, “I have certainly become rich,
I have found wealth for myself;
In all my labors they will find in me
No wrongdoing, which would be sin.”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
I have also spoken to the prophets,
And I provided many visions,
And through the prophets I spoke in parables.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Is there injustice in Gilead?
Certainly they are worthless.
In Gilgal they sacrifice bulls,
Yes, their altars are like stone heaps
Beside the furrows of a field.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Now Jacob fled to the land of Aram,
And Israel worked for a wife,
And for a wife he kept sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But by a prophet the Lord brought Israel up from Egypt,
And by a prophet he was protected.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
When Ephraim spoke, there was trembling.
He exalted himself in Israel,
But through Baal he incurred guilt and died.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And now they sin more and more,
And make for themselves cast metal images,
Idols skillfully made from their silver,
All of them the work of craftsmen.
They say of them, “Let the people who sacrifice kiss the calves!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore they will be like the morning cloud
And like dew which soon disappears,
Like chaff which is blown away from the threshing floor,
And like smoke from a chimney.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet I have been the Lord your God
Since the land of Egypt;
And you were not to know any god except Me,
For there is no savior besides Me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I cared for you in the wilderness,
In the land of drought.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
So I will be like a lion to them;
Like a leopard I will lie in wait by the wayside.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will confront them like a bear deprived of her cubs,
And I will tear open their chests;
I will also devour them there like a lioness,
As a wild animal would tear them to pieces.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is to your own destruction, Israel,
That you are against Me, against your help.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Where then is your king,
That he might save you in all your cities;
And your judges, to whom you said,
“Give me a king and princes”?
speaker: Narrator

text:
I gave you a king in My anger,
And took him away in My wrath.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The guilt of Ephraim is wrapped up;
His sin is stored up.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Shall I ransom them from the power of Sheol?
Shall I redeem them from death?
Death, where are your thorns?
Sheol, where is your sting?
Compassion will be hidden from My sight.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Samaria will pay the penalty for her guilt,
Because she has rebelled against her God.
They will fall by the sword,
Their children will be slaughtered,
And their pregnant women will be ripped open.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Return, Israel, to the Lord your God,
For you have stumbled because of your wrongdoing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Take words with you and return to the Lord.
Say to Him, “Take away all guilt
And receive us graciously,
So that we may present the fruit of our lips.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
I will heal their apostasy,
I will love them freely,
Because My anger has turned away from them.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
His shoots will sprout,
His majesty will be like the olive tree,
And his fragrance like the cedars of Lebanon.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who live in his shadow
Will again raise grain,
And they will blossom like the vine.
His fame will be like the wine of Lebanon.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Ephraim, what more have I to do with idols?
It is I who answer and look after you.
I am like a luxuriant juniper;
From Me comes your fruit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Whoever is wise, let him understand these things;
Whoever is discerning, let him know them.
For the ways of the Lord are right,
And the righteous will walk in them,
But wrongdoers will stumble in them.
speaker: Narrator
